metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Git .gitattributes
What is .gitattributes ?
The .gitattributes file is a special file that tells Git how to handle specific files in your repository.
content.html: The .gitattributes file is a special file that tells Git how to handle specific files in your repository.

content.text: It controls things like line endings, file types, merge behavior, custom diff tools, and more.
content.html: It controls things like line endings, file types, merge behavior, custom diff tools, and more.

content.text: Everyone on your team gets the same settings because this file is versioned with your project.
content.html: Everyone on your team gets the same settings because this file is versioned with your project.

content.text: For more about Git LFS, see the dedicated page .
content.html: For more about Git LFS, see the dedicated page.

content.text: When to Use .gitattributes
Create or Edit .gitattributes

content.code_html: *.txt text eol=lf

content.text: Handle Line Endings
Standardize line endings to avoid merge conflicts and broken files across different OSes.
content.html: Standardize line endings to avoid merge conflicts and broken files across different OSes.

content.code_html: *.sh text eol=lf

content.text: Mark Files as Binary
Tell Git which files are binary (not text).
content.html: Tell Git which files are binary (not text).

content.text: This prevents Git from trying to merge or change line endings for these files.
content.html: This prevents Git from trying to merge or change line endings for these files.

content.text: Enable LFS for File Types
Use Git LFS for large files like images or datasets.
content.html: Use Git LFS for large files like images or datasets.

content.text: This tells Git to use LFS for these files:
content.html: This tells Git to use LFS for these files:

content.code_html: *.psd filter=lfs diff=lfs merge=lfs -text

content.text: Custom Diff Settings
Tell Git to use a special tool to compare certain file types (like Markdown or Jupyter notebooks):
content.html: Tell Git to use a special tool to compare certain file types (like Markdown or Jupyter notebooks):

content.text: Check Attributes
See what attributes are set for a file:
content.html: See what attributes are set for a file:

content.code_html: git check-attr --all README.md

content.text: Advanced Usage
Tips & Best Practices
Note: .gitattributes is versioned with your project, so everyone on your team gets the same settings.
content.html: Note: .gitattributes is versioned with your project, so everyone on your team gets the same settings.
